	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Embratel was fined Ps.1,773 million (approximately R$320 million) by the Brazilian Federal Revenue Service for not making certain filings in the correct form from 2002 through 2005. The Company is contesting this fine
	on various grounds. The Company has not established a provision in the accompanying financial statements to cover losses arising from this contingency.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Embrapar, Embratel, Star One and TdB have received assessments in the total amount of Ps.1,435 million (approximately R$259 million), mainly related to allegedly nonpayment of the IRRF and CIDE and overpayments related
	to outbound traffic. The Company is challenging those assessments in administrative and judicial proceedings. The Company has established a provision of Ps.11 million (approximately R$2 million) in the accompanying financial statements for the
	losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Regulatory Matters
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Anatel Inflation-Related Adjustments
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Anatel
	challenged the calculation of inflation-related adjustments due under the agreements it had with Tess, S.A. (&#147;
<U>
	Tess
</U>
	&#148;), and ATL, two of our Brazilian subsidiaries that were merged with and into Claro Brasil, which assumed their rights
	and obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the agreements with Anatel, 40% of the concession price was due upon execution and 60% was due in three equal annual installments
	(subject to inflation-related adjustments and interest), beginning in 1999. The companies made all payments, but Anatel challenged the companies&#146; calculation of the inflation-related adjustments related to the payment corresponding to 60% of
	the concession price, alleging that such calculation resulted in a shortfall, and requesting additional payment. The amount of this shortfall and the method used to calculate monetary correction are subject to judicial disputes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-119
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage250"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D913893D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The companies filed declaratory and consignment actions seeking resolution of the disputes. The court of first
	instance ruled against ATL&#146;s declaratory suit in October 2001 and ATL&#146;s consignment action in September 2002. Subsequently, ATL filed appeals, which are still pending. Similarly, the court of first instance ruled against Tess&#146;
	consignment action in June 2003 and against Tess&#146; filing for declaratory action in February 2009. Tess also filed an appeal, which is still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In December 2008, Anatel charged Tess approximately Ps.1,491 million (approximately R$269 million). Tess obtained an injunction from the Federal Court of
	Appeals suspending payment until the pending appeal is resolved. Similarly, in March 2009, Anatel charged ATL approximately Ps.1,058 million (approximately R$191&nbsp;million). ATL also obtained an injunction from the Federal Court of Appeals
	suspending payment until the pending appeal is resolved. In April 2013, the appeal filed by ATL with respect to the declaratory suit was denied, and Claro Brasil filed a new appeal.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company calculated the amount of the shortfall based on a specific method and certain assumptions. If other methods or assumptions are used, the amount of
	damages may increase. In September 2014, Anatel calculated monetary correction in a total amount of Ps.8,866 million (approximately R$1.6 billion).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	Company has established a provision of Ps.3,302 million (approximately R$596 million), in the accompanying financial statements for losses arising from these contingencies which the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Consumer Protection Lawsuit (DPDC)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In July 2009,
	the Brazilian Federal and State Prosecutor Office, along with the Consumer Protection and Defense Agency and other Brazilian consumer protection agencies, initiated a lawsuit against Claro Brasil alleging that it has violated certain regulations
	governing the provision of telecommunications services. The amount claimed by the plaintiffs is Ps.1,662&nbsp;million (approximately R$300 million). In September 2013, the relevant court ruled against Claro Brasil, and awarded the plaintiff Ps.166
	million (approximately R$30 million). The plaintiffs and Claro Brasil challenged the ruling and those challenges are still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has not
	established a provision in the accompanying financial statements to cover losses arising from this contingency, which the Company does not consider probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Implementation of the new national domestic telephone number system
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a result of alleged service disruptions caused during the implementation of a new domestic dialing system in 1999, Embratel was fined by Anatel and DPDC,
	and several class actions were initiated against it. The aggregate total amount of these contingencies is Ps.887 million (approximately R$160 million). The Company contested these claims and in 2014 the Company obtained a favorable decision. The
	fine, applied by the Rio de Janeiro&#146;s Consumer Protection Agency, was nullified.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Administrative proceedings (PADOs)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Anatel filed several administrative proceedings (
<I>
	Procedimentos Administrativos de Descumprimento de Obriga&ccedil;&atilde;o
</I>
	, or
	&#147;
<U>
	PADOs
</U>
	&#148;), against Claro Brasil in the amount of Ps.610 million (approximately R$110 million), because of alleged noncompliance with quality targets set by Anatel. The Company is contesting the PADOs on various grounds. The Company
	has established a provision of Ps.388 million (approximately R$70 million), in the accompanying financial statements for the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-120
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage251"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D913893D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Anatel filed several administrative proceedings (PADOs), against Embratel and Embrapar in the amount of Ps.4,305
	million (approximately R$777 million), because of alleged noncompliance with quality targets set by Anatel. The Company is contesting the PADOs on various grounds. The Company has established a provision of Ps.89 million (approximately R$16
	million), in the accompanying financial statements for the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Other civil
	and labor contingencies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Claro Brasil and its subsidiaries are also party to other claims in the amount of Ps.9,846 million (approximately R$1,777
	million), including claims filed by its telephone service customers and claims relating to environmental matters. The Company is contesting the cases, which are in various stages. The Company has established a provision of Ps.382 million
	(approximately R$69 million), in the accompanying financial statements for the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Claro Brasil and its subsidiaries are party to labor claims in the amount of Ps.6,716 million (approximately R$1,212 million), filed by its current and former
	employees, alleging compensation for pension and other social benefits, overtime work, outsourcing and equal pay. The Company has established a provision of Ps.765 million (approximately R$138 million) in the accompanying financial statements for
	the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Embratel and its subsidiaries are also party to other claims in the
	amount of Ps.4,012 million (approximately R$724 million), including claims filed by its telephone service customers and claims relating to environmental matters. The Company is contesting the cases, which are in various stages. The Company has
	established a provision of Ps.305 million (approximately R$55 million), in the accompanying financial statements for the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Embratel and its subsidiaries are party to labor claims in the amount of Ps.4,771 million (approximately R$861 million), filed by its current and former
	employees, alleging compensation for pension and other social benefits, overtime work, outsourcing and equal pay. The Company has established a provision of Ps.582 million (approximately R$105 million), in the accompanying financial statements for
	the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net Servi&ccedil;os and its subsidiaries are also party to other claims
	in the amount of Ps.3,712 million (approximately R$670 million), including claims filed by its Pay TV, internet access and telephone service customers. The Company is contesting the cases, which are in various stages. The Company has established a
	provision of Ps.948 million (approximately R$171 million), in the accompanying financial statements for the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net Servi&ccedil;os and its subsidiaries are party to labor claims in the amount of Ps.9,215 million (approximately R$1,663 million), filed by its current and
	former employees, seeking additional compensation for performing high-risk activities and for overtime work and commissions. The Company has established a provision of Ps.831 million (approximately R$150 million), in the accompanying financial
	statements for the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Disputes with third parties
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Claro Brasil and Americel are parties to certain disputes with third parties in connection with former sales agents, class actions (ACP&#146;s), real estate
	issues, and other matters in the aggregate amount of Ps.2,903 million (approximately R$524 million). The Company has established a provision of Ps.122 million (approximately R$22 million), in the accompanying financial statements for the losses
	arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-121
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage252"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D913893D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Embratel, TdB, Primesys and Brasil Center are parties to a number of cases on a range of matters, including,
	among other things, disputes with former sales agents and disputes with former employees regarding health care payments. The cases, which are in advanced stages of the litigation process, are for claims in the amount of Ps.2,266 million
	(approximately R$409 million). The Company has established a provision of Ps.1,042 million (approximately R$188 million), in the accompanying financial statements for the losses arising from these contingencies that the Company considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Ecuador
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Conecel
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Tax Assessments
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During 2008, the Ecuadorian
	Internal Revenue Services (
<I>
	Servicios de Rentas Internas del Ecuador
</I>
	, or
<I>
</I>
	&#147;
<U>
	SRI
</U>
	&#148;) notified Conecel of tax assessments in the amount of Ps.2,031 million (approximately US$138 million) (not including interest and
	penalties), relating to special consumption (ICE), value-added, income and withholding taxes for the years 2003 to 2006. In March 2008, Conecel paid a portion of these tax assessments, including fines, and challenged the outstanding amount with the
	SRI and, subsequently, with a Tax Court in Guayaquil. In March 2012, such Tax Court issued a favorable resolution with respect to Ps.353 million (approximately US$24 million). Following a series of unfavorable judicial decisions, in July 2013 and
	May 2014, Conecel paid the outstanding portion of the tax assessments, in an aggregate amount of Ps.2,164 (approximately US$147 million), including principal and accrued interest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2011 and 2012, SRI notified Conecel of tax assessments in the amount of 1,751 million (approximately US$119 million), relating to income taxes for the
	2007, 2008 and 2009 fiscal years. Conecel began certain judicial proceedings challenging the tax assessments and final resolutions for the challenges to the resolutions relating to the years 2008 and 2009 are still pending. The National Court of
	Justice, however, issued a final ruling in connection with Conecel&#146;s income tax for the year 2007 and determined that Conecel had to pay Ps.706 million (approximately US$48 million), including principal and accrued interest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has established a provision of Ps.235 million (approximately US$16 million) in the accompanying financial statements for the loss arising from
	these contingencies that AMX considers probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Fine imposed by the SCPM
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
	In February 2014, following a regulatory claim filed in 2012 by the state-owned operator, Superintendency of Control of Market Power
	(
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
<I>
	Superintendencia de Control del Poder del Mercado
</I>
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
	or &#147;
<U>
	SCPM
</U>
	&#148;), imposed a fine on Conecel of Ps.2,037 million (US$138 million), for alleged monopolistic practices related to five locations which the
	state-owned operator argues that Conecel has exclusive rights to deploy its network preventing others from doing so. In March 2014, Conecel challenged the fine and posted a guarantee for 50% of its value. Through a judicial order issued during the
	same month, the competent court admitted Conecel&#146;s lawsuit and suspended the effects of the contested fine. A final resolution is still pending.
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has not established a provision in the accompanying financial statements to cover losses arising from this contingency.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-122
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage253"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D913893D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Peru
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	OSIPTEL&#151;Monopolistic practices investigations
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Along with another mobile operator, Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil Per&uacute;, S.A.C. (&#147;
<U>
	Claro Per&uacute;
</U>
	&#148;), was the target of an investigation
	into alleged monopolistic practices conducted by the Peruvian National Regulatory Authority (
<I>
	Organismo Supervisor de la Inversi&oacute;n Privada en Telecomunicaciones
</I>
	, or &#147;
<U>
	OSIPTEL
</U>
	&#148;), related to mobile international long
	distance rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	OSIPTEL fined Claro Peru Ps.2 million (approximately US$118,000) for monopolistic practices (price-squeezing in long distance tariffs).
	Although the fine is well below the maximum amount established by law, Claro Peru appealed the decision before the Administrative Tribunal in OSIPTEL, considering that the fine is unjustified and the decision has serious inconsistencies. If
	necessary, Claro Per&uacute; would also seek to challenge the resolution in Courts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has not established a provision in the accompanying
	financial statements to cover losses arising from this contingency.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Bulgaria
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Mobiltel
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Tax Assessment
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In June 2014, the Bulgarian tax authorities issued a tax assessment regarding accounting of brand name and customer base amortized by Mobiltel EAD
	(&#147;
<U>
	Mobiltel
</U>
	&#148;) for the years 2006 and 2007. The total amount of the tax assessment is approximately Ps.338 million (approximately &#128;19 million). Mobiltel initiated administrative proceedings with the highest Bulgarian tax
	authority challenging the resolution. On December 1, 2014, Mobiltel was notified that the resolution was upheld. Mobiltel challenged the resolution before the competent judicial courts and such challenge is pending. Mobiltel issued a bank guarantee
	covering up to Ps.410 million (approximately &#128;23 million). In case of an unfavorable decision by the competent judicial courts, Mobiltel might face a further potential additional claim for the years 2008 to 2012 in the amount of up to Ps.1,318
	million (approximately &#128;74 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	21. Segments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil operates in different countries. As mentioned in Note 1, the Company has operations in Mexico, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Ecuador, El
	Salvador, Costa Rica, Brazil, Argentina, Colombia, United States, Honduras, Chile, Peru, Paraguay, Uruguay, Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, Panama, Austria, Croatia, Bulgaria, Belarus, Macedonian, Serbia and Slovenia. The accounting policies for
	the segments are the same as those described in Note 2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The CEO, who is the Chief Operating Decision Maker (&#147;CODM&#148;), analyzes the financial and
	operating information by geographical segment, except for Mexico, which shows Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil (Corporate and Telcel) and Telmex as two segments. All significant operating segments that (i)&nbsp;represent more than 10% of consolidated
	revenues, (ii)&nbsp;more than the absolute amount of its reported 10% of profits or loss and (iii)&nbsp;more than 10% of consolidated assets, are presented separately.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has aggregated operating segments into the following reporting segments for purposes of its consolidated financial statements: Southern cone
	includes Argentina, Chile, Paraguay and Uruguay; Andean includes Ecuador and Peru.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company is of the view that the quantitative and qualitative
	aspects of the aggregated operating segments are similar in nature for all periods presented. In evaluating the appropriateness of aggregating operating segments, the key qualitative indicators include but not were limited to: (i)&nbsp;all entities
	provide telecommunications services, (ii)&nbsp;similarities of customer bases and services, (iii)&nbsp;the methods to distribute services are the same, based on telephone plant in both cases, wireless and fixed lines, (iv)&nbsp;similarities of
	governments and regulatory entities that oversee the activities and services that telecom companies, (v)&nbsp;inflation trends and (vi)&nbsp;currency trends.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-123
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage254"></A>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_146"></A>

<A NAME="eolPage256"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D913893D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	22. Components of other comprehensive income
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The movements on the components of the other comprehensive income (loss) for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2012, 2013 and 2014 is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_148"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="84%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	23. Subsequent Events
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a)
	On January&nbsp;9, 2015, the Federal Telecommunications Institute (
<I>
	Instituto Federal de Telecomunicaciones,
</I>
	or &#147;IFT&#148;) imposed a fine of Ps.14,400 on Telmex for failing to disclose to the IFT, in November of 2008, what the IFT has
	called a merger (
<I>
	concentraci&oacute;n
</I>
	) between Telmex and Dish M&eacute;xico Holdings, S. de R.L. de C.V., and its related companies. AMX will exercise any and all legal remedies to challenge the IFT&#146;s resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	b) On January 2015, the Company (through its subsidiary &#147;Tracfone&#148;) and the Federal Trade Commission (&#147;FTC&#148;) finalized the terms of a
	stipulated order, related to the Company&#146;s prior practice of marketing data. The order included payment of US$40,000 to the FTC to be deposited into a fund administered by the FTC or its designee to be used for consumer redress as a fixed
	payment amount, and for any expenses for the administration of the fund.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company had recorded a provision for
	settlement of the FTC and class action law suits. The total amount of US$45,100 was included in accounts payable in the consolidated statements of financial position as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, and as Other expenses in the consolidated statement
	of comprehensive income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-126
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage257"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D913893D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	c) On March, 2015, the Company reported that its Board of Directors decided to submit to the Annual Ordinary
	General Shareholders&#146; Meeting to be held on or before April&nbsp;30,2015 to (i)&nbsp;pay a cash dividend from the profit tax account (cuenta de utilidad fiscal or &#147;CUFIN&#148;), of Ps.0.26 , payable in two installments, to each of the
	shares of its capital stock series &#147;AA&#148;, &#147;A&#148; and &#147;L&#148; (which includes the preferred dividend correspondent to the series &#147;L&#148; shares), subject to adjustments arising from other corporate events (including
	repurchase or placement of its own shares), that may vary the number of shares outstanding as of the date of said dividend payment;(ii) pay a cash dividend from the profit tax account CUFIN, of Ps.0.30 , payable in one installment during September
	2015, to each of the shares of its capital stock series &#147;AA&#148;, &#147;A&#148; and &#147;L&#148;, subject to adjustments arising from other corporate events (including repurchase or placement of its own shares), that may vary the number of
	shares outstanding as of the date of said dividend payment; and (iii)&nbsp;allocate the amount of Ps.35,000,000, to repurchase shares from April 2015 to April 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	d) On March 2015, the Company entered that a settlement agreement has been entered into with Axtel, S.A.B. de C.V. and Avantel, S. de R.L. de C.V.
	(collectively, &#147;Axtel&#148;). Pursuant to such settlement agreement, certain disputes regarding termination rates and related interconnection matters have been finally settled between Axtel, on the one hand, and Telcel, Telmex and
	Tel&eacute;fonos del Noroeste (&#147;Telnor&#148;), on the other.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As part of the settlement agreement, Axtel and Telcel executed interconnection services
	agreements. With the execution of these agreements all disputes regarding mobile termination rates and related interconnection proceedings that started in 2005 have been finally settled between the parties. In addition, disputed and outstanding
	amounts related to mobile termination services for the period from 2005 to 2014 have been paid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In consideration for the execution of the settlement
	agreement; the execution of interconnection services agreements with Telcel for the period from 2005 to 2015; the settlement and termination of certain existing disputes and claims with Telcel, Telmex and Telnor; and the assignment to Am&eacute;rica
	M&oacute;vil of certain litigation rights arising from administrative and judicial proceedings existing between the parties, Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil paid Axtel Ps.950,000, which was recognized in the consolidated statement of comprehensive
	income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	e) On April&nbsp;17, 2015 the Extraordinary Shareholders&#146; approved the spin-off from Am&eacute;rica
	M&oacute;vil of a newly created company, and the contribution to such new company of certain assets (mainly comprised of the passive infrastructure used by its wireless operations in Mexico), liabilities and equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-127
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	24. Supplemental Guarantor Information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As mentioned in Note 16, the Company has issued senior notes in the United States. These notes are fully and unconditionally guaranteed by Telcel.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Consolidating Condensed Financial Information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	following consolidating information presents condensed consolidating statement of financial position as of December&nbsp;31, 2013 and 2014 and condensed consolidating statements of comprehensive income and cash flows for each of the three years in
	the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 of the Company and Telcel (the &#147;wholly-owned Guarantor Subsidiary&#148;). These statements are prepared in accordance with IFRS with the exception that the subsidiaries are accounted for as investments
	under the equity method rather than being consolidated. The guarantees of the Guarantor are full and unconditional.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s consolidating
	condensed financial information for the (i)&nbsp;Company; (ii)&nbsp;its wholly-owned subsidiary Telcel (on standalone basis), which is a wholly and unconditional guarantor under the Senior Notes; (iii)&nbsp;the combined non-guarantor subsidiaries;
	iv) eliminations and v) the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="83%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>

<TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage266"></A>
<A NAME="D913893DEX44_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_4>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_4"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 4.4
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This
<B>
	TERMINATION AGREEMENT TO MANAGEMENT SERVICES AGREEMENT
</B>
	(this &#147;Termination Agreement&#148;) is entered into as of May&nbsp;22,
	2014 (the &#147;Agreement Date&#148; to be effective as of May&nbsp;19, 2014 (the &#147;Termination Date&#148;), between AT&amp;T MEXICO, LLC. (formerly known as AT&amp;T MEXICO, INC.), a limited liability company duly organized under the laws of
	the State of Delaware, United States of America (&#147;U.S.A.&#148;), with headquarters in Wilmington, Delaware, U.S.A., and permanent establishment in the United Mexican States under the Income Tax Law with address at Lago Zurich No.&nbsp;245,
	Edificio Presa Falc&oacute;n, Piso 14, Colonia Ampliaci&oacute;n Granada, 11529, Mexico City (hereinafter &#147;AT&amp;T MEXICO&#148;) and AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL, S.A.B. DE C.V., a
<I>
	sociedad an&oacute;nima burs&aacute;til de capital
	variable
</I>
	duly organized under the laws of the United Mexican States, with its principal place of business in Mexico City (hereinafter &#147;AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL&#148;) (each a &#147;Party&#148; and, collectively the &#147;Parties&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	WITNESSETH:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	WHEREAS,
</B>
	AT&amp;T MEXICO and AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL entered into that certain Management Services Agreement dated
	February&nbsp;27, 2002 as amended by that certain First Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of January&nbsp;1, 2003; that certain Second Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of October&nbsp;29, 2003; that certain Third
	Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of January&nbsp;1, 2004; that certain Fourth Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of January&nbsp;31, 2005; that certain Fifth Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2005; that certain Sixth Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of February&nbsp;1, 2007; that certain Seventh Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of July&nbsp;7, 2010; that certain Eighth Amendment to
	Management Services Agreement dated as of September&nbsp;23, 2009; that certain Ninth Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of November&nbsp;18, 2009; that certain Tenth Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of
	August&nbsp;3, 2010; that certain Eleventh Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of February&nbsp;8, 2011; that certain Twelfth Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of July&nbsp;12, 2012; and that certain Thirteenth
	Amendment to Management Services Agreement dated as of December&nbsp;11, 2012 (as amended, the &#147;MSA&#148;). Capitalized terms not otherwise defined herein shall have the meaning ascribed to such terms in the MSA; and
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage267"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	WHEREAS,
</B>
	AT&amp;T MEXICO and AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL desire to terminate the MSA, as
	provided herein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NOW, THEREFORE,
</B>
	in consideration of the premises and the mutual agreements and covenants hereinafter set forth,
	the Parties hereto hereby agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.
<B>
	Termination of the MSA.
</B>
	Effective upon the Termination Date, the MSA is hereby
	terminated; provided, however, that the confidentiality obligations and those other obligations under the MSA which by their nature or as specifically provided for in the MSA would continue beyond such termination shall survive such termination. For
	avoidance of doubt, the Parties agree that: (i)&nbsp;The notice requirements under Clause Sixth of the MSA shall not apply to the termination set forth herein, and (ii)&nbsp;AT&amp;T MEXICO shall, no later than 10 business days after the Agreement
	Date, make a fixed payment to AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL in the amount of US$374,193.55 (such amount representing a return of the pro rata portion of the monthly payment of US$833,333.33, including value added tax, made by AM&Eacute;RICA
	M&Oacute;VIL pursuant to Clause Fourth of the MSA with respect to May 2014, based on the number of days in such month after, and not including, the Termination Date).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.
<B>
	Information.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In
	accordance with Clause Second, Section&nbsp;4 of the MSA, AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL hereby requests, and AT&amp;T MEXICO agrees and warrants that it will promptly take all necessary actions to ensure that, (i)&nbsp;all documents containing or
	reflecting Information delivered by AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL pursuant to the MSA shall be returned to AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL and (ii)&nbsp;all documents or computer files prepared by AT&amp;T MEXICO (including any of its Recipients) based on
	Information delivered by AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL pursuant to the MSA shall be destroyed.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage268"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.
<B>
	Release from Liability.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL, hereby forever releases, waives and discharges AT&amp;T MEXICO and its affiliates from any and all proceedings, actions, causes of action, suits, debts, covenants, contracts, controversies,
	agreements, promises, variances, damages, judgments, settlements, assessments, penalties, executions, claims, obligations, costs, expenses, losses, exposures, liabilities, duties and demands whatsoever, of every name and nature, in law or equity,
	known or unknown, suspected or unsuspected (collectively, &#147;Claims&#148;), which AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL ever had, now has or hereafter can, shall or may have against AT&amp;T MEXICO or its affiliates arising from any and all obligations
	under the MSA, except as provided under Section&nbsp;1 or Section&nbsp;2 of this Termination Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	AT&amp;T MEXICO hereby forever releases, waives and discharges AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL and its affiliates from any and all Claims which AT&amp;T MEXICO ever had, now has or hereafter can, shall or may have against
	AM&Eacute;RICA M&Oacute;VIL or its affiliates arising from any and all obligations under the MSA, except as provided under Section&nbsp;1 of this Termination Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.
<B>
	Further Assurances.
</B>
	Each of the parties hereto agrees, and agrees to cause their respective affiliates, to execute any such
	additional documents or releases from liability and to take any such additional actions as may be reasonably requested by any other party to give effect to the provisions of and transactions contemplated by this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.
<B>
	Counterparts.
</B>
	This Termination Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, and by the Parties hereto in separate
	counterparts, each of which when executed shall be deemed to be an original but all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same agreement.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage269"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.
<B>
	Governing Law.
</B>
	This Termination Agreement shall be governed by and construed in
	accordance with the laws of Mexico City, without respect to its conflicts of law principles.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	IN WITNESS WHEREOF,
</B>
	each of the
	Parties has caused this Termination Agreement to be signed and delivered by its duly authorized officer as of the date first above written.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Exhibit 8.1
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	List of Certain Subsidiaries of Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil, S.A.B. de C.V.
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of
	March&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH="65%">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">

</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:64PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	Name of Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	Jurisdiction
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	Ownership
<BR>
	Interest
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	(1)
</SUP>
</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	I, Daniel Hajj Aboumrad, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil, S.A.B. de C.V.;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in
	light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</FONT>
</TD>

	3.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial
	condition, results of operations and cash flows of the company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

	4.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The company&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	and&nbsp;15d-15(e))
</FONT>
	and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f)
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	and&nbsp;15d-15(f))
</FONT>
	for the company and have:
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
	information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</FONT>
</TD>

	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide
	reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</FONT>
</TD>

	(c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
	disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	affect the company&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	reporting.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Officer Certifications
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the
	Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Subsections (a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;1350, Chapter 63 of Title 18, United
	States Code)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Pursuant to section&nbsp;906 of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Sarbanes-Oxley
</FONT>
	Act of 2002 (subsections
	(a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;of section&nbsp;1350, chapter&nbsp;63 of title&nbsp;18, United States Code), each of the undersigned officers of Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil, S.A.B. de C.V., a
<I>
	sociedad an&oacute;nima burs&aacute;til de capital variable
</I>
	organized under the laws of Mexico (the &#147;Company&#148;), does hereby certify to such officer&#146;s knowledge that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The annual report on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Form&nbsp;20-F
</FONT>
	for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 (the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#147;Form&nbsp;20-F&#148;)
</FONT>
	of the Company fully complies with the requirements of
	section&nbsp;13(a) or&nbsp;15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and information contained in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Form&nbsp;20-F
</FONT>
	fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of
	operations of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Dated: April&nbsp;30, 2015
</FONT>
</P>

	respect to the consolidated financial statements of Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil, S.A.B. de C.V. and subsidiaries, and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting of Am&eacute;rica M&oacute;vil, S.A.B. de C.V., included in this
	Annual Report on

	Form&nbsp;20-F
